title: Getting to know Wales' rookie flanker Aaron Wainwright: From Cardiff City academy footballer to being labelled the next Sam Warburton
text:
Given Warren Gatland had just named a rookie 22-year-old flanker to start a World Cup quarter-final with France instead of a much more experienced operator, the question from the floor was valid.

The Wales head coach was asked if there had been any debate over his back-row selection for Sunday's crunch clash with Les Bleus after he had selected Aaron Wainwright over Ross Moriarty to complete his loose forward trio alongside the established Justin Tipuric and Josh Navidi.

“No, not really,” came the New Zealander’s reply. It was hardly quote of the year, but as a ringing endorsement for Wainwright it couldn’t have been bigger. He is fully deserving of his starting spot.

The Dragons forward has...
description: Given Warren Gatland had just named a rookie 22-year-old flanker to start a World Cup quarter-final with France instead of a much more experienced operator, the question from the floor was valid.
